sense.definition: expressing the end location of motion or extension (e.g. walked to NYC)
indicating attachment or linkage with something (e.g., attached to the car)
approaching or reaching (a particular state/condition/circumstances/relationship) (e.g., turned to dust)
expressing an extent or point reached along a particular scale or range (e.g., changed to $5)
indicating the recipient of communication (e.g., talked to Joe)
indicating the recipient of possession (e.g., bequeathed the ball to Joe)
indicating the target of focused perception (e.g., listen to Joe)
indicating the topic or subject matter (used with a handful of assertive communicative words such as 'testify') (e.g., testify to the truth)
indicating a complement of a relational noun, verb, or predicative adjective (e.g., allergic to corn)
(in telling the time) until/before (the time/hour specified) (e.g., it is 5 minutes to midnight)
indicating a rate of return on something, for example the distance travelled in exchange for fuel used (e.g., it gets 40 miles to the gallon)
(mathematics) indicating the power (exponent) to which a number is raised
in comparison with (e.g., the club's nothing to what it once was)
governing a phrase expressing someone's reaction to something (e.g., to her astonishment, he smiled)
